what: Interpolating splines, smoothing splines and b-splines
title: Interpolating splines, smoothing splines and b-splines
text: goal smouseGPS smooth interpolate noisy GPS data. enables deal outliers indentifying thanks collection b-splines. package based work Jeffrey J. Early Adam M. Sykulski (https://jeffreyearly.com/smoothing--interpolating-noisy-gps-data/). translation Matlab language R language. documentation github page alexmerot.github.io/smouseGPS/.

what: Utils for the bspline class — point_of_support
title: Utils for the bspline class — point_of_support
text: list utils bspline class. can used synthax bs_utils$function_name(). functions equivalent static methods bspline class.

title: Utils for the bspline class — point_of_support
code: point_of_support(t_knot, K, D)  pp_coeff_from_spline_coeff(m, t_knot, K, B)  evaluate_from_pp_coeff(t, C, t_pp, D)  spline(t, t_knot, K, D)  bs_utils

title: Utils for the bspline class — point_of_support
text: object class bspline_static_methods length 4.

title: Utils for the bspline class — point_of_support
text: t_knot matrix. Spline knot points. K integer. Order polynomial. D array. m numeric. Spline coefficients (\(m = M \cdot D\)). B array. t matrix. Point locations. C vector. Piecewise polynomial coefficients (size(C) = [nrow(t_pp)-1, K]) t_pp matrix. pp break points (size(t_pp) = nrow(t_knot) - 2*K + 1).

title: Utils for the bspline class — point_of_support
text: bs_utils list containing functions bspline class.

title: Utils for the bspline class — point_of_support
text: point_of_support(): static method assumes splines terminated boundary repeat knot points. pp_coeff_from_spline_coeff(): Returns piecewise polynomial coefficients matrix C spline coefficients vector m. evaluate_from_pp_coeff(): Returns value function derivative D represented PP coefficients C locations t. t_pp containes intervals. spline(): Returns basis splines order K evaluated point t, given knot points t_knot. optionally provide D, D derivatives returned. dim(B) = c(nrow(t), M, D) M = nrow(t_knot) - K number splines.

what: R6 class that creates b-splines. — bspline
title: R6 class that creates b-splines. — bspline
text: Creates b-splines given set knot points, evaluates splines given set coefficients splines. 3 arguments initialisation : f = BSpline(K, t_knot, m).

title: R6 class that creates b-splines. — bspline
code: # S3 method for bspline [(obj, t = NULL, n = NULL)  # S3 method for bspline [(obj, t = NULL, n = NULL) <- value

title: R6 class that creates b-splines. — bspline
text: obj bspline object t points n number derivatives value value

title: R6 class that creates b-splines. — bspline
text: b-splines

title: R6 class that creates b-splines. — bspline
text: Overloaded subscript operator Overloaded subscript operator assignment

title: R6 class that creates b-splines. — bspline
text: t_knot Matrix. Spline knot points. K integer. Order polynomial. m numeric. Spline coefficients (\(m = M \cdot D\)). B numeric array 3 dimension. x_mean numeric. set, used scale output (default 0). x_std numeric. \(x_{} = x_{std} \cdot (X \cdot m) + x_{mean}\) t_pp numeric columnwise matrix. pp break points (size(t_pp) = nrow(t_knot) - 2*K + 1). C vector. Piecewise polynomial coefficients (size(C) = [nrow(t_pp)-1, K]).

title: R6 class that creates b-splines. — bspline
text: get_S Get \(S = K - 1\) get_domain Get domain t_knot
